name: Pimania
description: You are a normal person, finding oneself in the strange world of Piland, a surreal place containing the secret of the wondrous Golden Sundial of Pi. After figuring out how to properly enter Piland, you must find clues to the Sundial's location, with the help (and hindrance) of the Piman, a strange little creature with distinct likes and dislikes. The Sundial is not actually in the game - it was the prize of a contest, won using the clues within the game.
alsoFor: BBC Micro, Dragon 32/64, ZX81 | Combined View

shot.caption: While the game loads this symbol is displayed. It flashes from yellow/black to black/yellow very fast
Loading is followed by a further, but brief, delay
Then a dire warning about piracy is displayed. The game halts here for what seems like ages to make sure the message sinks in
Then there's another lengthy wait while the game makes the terms of the awarding of the game's prize crystal clear
The player's id is a must for this game
At last! The game begins, or it will when a key is pressed
This, believe it or not, is the first screen. It's also the game's first puzzle.
This is the Pi-Man. He appears and does a little dance
He disappears leaving behind a message ....
... and the flashing text version of maniacal laughter.
So is the game about to start now?
Remember the game is about gates so before each choice the game displays this symbol. It starts out small and grows to fill the screen. It becomes very tedious
This is the real start of the game. Its up to the player to select something meaningful. Until that happens the game cycles round re-displaying the Pi symbol and returning to this screen
Entering numbers is different to entering North, South, East & West I suppose
Some colour combinations can be hard to read
Is this a puzzle screen or a simple instruction?
The list of items available marks this as a non-standard adventure game
